titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against the bill (H.R. 4453) making appropriations for military construction for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1995, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-523, by Mr. Hall (OH).
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4453. During consideration of the bill, all points of order against provisions in the bill for failure to comply with clause 2 or 6 of rule XXI are waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 165.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/23/1994--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 4453 (making FY 1995 military construction appropriations) with respect to noncompliance with provisions of rule XXI of the Rules of the House of Representatives.
